titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the James Koller Papers 1974.0002
titlestmt.author: Archives & Special Collections staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-07-23 16:12:08 -0400.

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of letters to James Koller from various friends and colleagues, including Philip Whalen, and original manuscripts and typescripts of Koller's poetry and novels.

bioghist.head: Biography of
bioghist.p: Born in 1936 in Oak Park, Illinois, Koller is an American poet, novelist, editor and publisher. Koller obtained his B.A. from North Central College in Naperville, Illinois, in 1958; he then moved to San Francisco where he became the editor of Coyote's Journal, and the publisher of Coyote Books. He later moved with the magazine to New Mexico, and then to Maine. Koller has authored twenty-seven collections of poetry and four novels, and was a National Endowment for the Arts fellowship recipient in both 1968 and 1973.

archdesc.scopecontent: Scope and Contents The collection primarily consists of letters to James Koller from various friends and colleagues (including Philip Whalen) and original manuscripts and typescripts of Koller's poetry and novels. The materials date from 1959-1986. Dan Cushman's novel Stay Away, Joe (New York: Viking Press, 1953) was originally included in the collection, attached to Bill Deemer's February 6, 1984 letter to Koller.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I: Correspondence has been arranged alphabetically according to the last name of each letter's author. Series II: Writings has been re-foldered to accommodate size, and arranged alphabetically according to the name of each piece. Photographs have been separated from their original letters or manuscripts and placed in envelopes in Series III, arranged alphabetically according to their description.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item, Folder #], James Koller Papers. Archives &and Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraryies.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the collection must be obtained in writing from the owner(s) of the copyright.
